gurmukhi: jb nMd prXo igr BUm ibKY qb Xwih khXo jdubIr Aey ]suin kY bqIXwN auT TwF BXo mn ky sB Sok prwie gey ]
transliteration: Jab Nand Daryo Gir Bhoom Bikhai Tab Yaah(i) Kahyo Jadoubeer Ae|| Soun(i) Kai Bateeyaan Outh Thaadh Bhayo Man Ke Sabh Shok Paraae Gad||
translation: When Nand fell down on the earth, Udhava said that the hero of Yadavas had come; hearing these words, forsaking his sorrow,

gurmukhi: auT kY suiD so ieh BwNq khXo hm jwnq aUDv pyc key ]qj kY biRj ko pur bIc gey iPr kY biRj mY nhI sXwm Aey ]895]
transliteration: Outh(i) Kai Sudh(i) So Eh Bhaant Kahyo Ham Jaanat Oodhav Pech Kae|| Taj Kai Brij Ko Pur Beech Gad Phir Kai Brij Mai Nahisyaam Ae||895||
translation: Nand stood up and said, “O Udava ! I know that you and Krishna have deceived us because after abandoning Braja and going to the city, Krishna had never returned.895.

gurmukhi: sXwm gey qij kY biRj ko biRj logn ko Aiq hI duKu dIno ]aUDv bwq suno hmrI iqh ky ibnu BXo hmro pur hIno ]
transliteration: Syaam Gad Taj(i) Kai Brij Ko Brij Logad Ko At(i) Hidoukh(u) Deeno|| Oodhav Baat Souno Hamritih Ke Bin(u) Bhyo Hamro Pur Heeno||
translation: “Krishna, forsaking Braja, has given extreme grief to all the people; O Udhava ! without him, Braja has become poor;

gurmukhi: dY ibiD nY hmry giH bwlk pwp ibnw hm qy iPir CIno ]XoN kih sIs Jukwie rhXo bhu Sok bFXo Aiq rodn kIno ]896]
transliteration: Dai Bidh(i) Nai Hamre Grah(i) Baalak Paap Binaa Ham Te Phir(i) Chheeno Yon Kah(i) Sees Jhoukaae Rahyo Bahu Shok Badhyo At(i) Rodan Keeno||896||
translation: “The Lord-God gave a son in our house, but we do not know, for which sin of our he has snatched him from us?” Saying this Nand bowed his head and began to weep.896.

gurmukhi: kih kY ieh bwq prXo Dir pY auT Pyr khXo sMg aUDv ieau ]qij kY biRj sXwm gey mQurw hm sMg kho Ab kwrin ikau ]
transliteration: Kah(i) Kai Eh Baat Daryo Dhar(i) Pai Outh Pher Kahyo San Oodhav Io|| Taj(i) Kai Brij Syaam Gad Mathuraa Ham San Kaho Ab Kaaran(i) Kio||
translation: Saying this, he fell down on the earth and getting up again, he said to Udhava, “O Udhava ! tell me the reason why Krishna has left Braja and has gone to Matura?

gurmukhi: qumry Ab pwie lgo auiT kY su BeI ibrQw su kho sB ijau ]iqhqy nhI lyq kCU suiD hY muih pwp pCwn kCU irs isau ]897]
transliteration: Toumre Ab Paae Lago Outh(i) Kai Su Bhaibirthaa Su Kaho Sabh Jio|| Tih-te Nahinet Kachhodh Sudh(i) Hai Muh(i) Paap Pachhaad Kachhodh Ris Sio||897||
translation: “I fall at your feet, you should give me all details; for what sin of mine, Krishna does not communicate with me?”897.

gurmukhi: suin kY iqn aUDv Xo bqIXw ieh BwNqin isau iqh au`qr dIno ]Qo suq so bsudyvih ko qum qy sB pY pRBjU nhI CIny ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Tin Oodhav Yo Bateeyaa Eh Bhaantan(i) Sio Tih Outtar Deeno|| Tho Sout So Basudevah(i) Ko Toum Te Sabh Pai Prabh-joo Nahichheene||
translation: Hearing these words, Udhava replied, “He was actually the son of Vasudev, the Lord-God has not snatched him from you;”

gurmukhi: suin kY puir ko piq XoN bqIXw kib sXwm ausws khY iqn lIno ]DIr gXo Cut rovq BXo ienhUM iqh dyKq rodn kIno ]897]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Pur(i) Ko Pat(i) Yon Bateeyaa Kabi Syaam Ousaas Kahai Tin Leeno|| Dheer Gado Chhodht Rovat Bhyo Inhoon Tih Dekhat Rodan Keeno||898||
translation: Hearing this, Nand heaved a cold sigh and lost patience; and seeing towards Udhava, he began to weep.898.

gurmukhi: hiT aUDv kY ieh BwNiq khXo pur ky piq so kCu Sok n kIjY ]sXwm khI muih jo bqIXw iqh kI ibrQw sBhI suin lIjY ]
transliteration: Hath(i) Oodhav Kai Eh Bhaant(i) Kahyo Pur Ke Pat(i) So Kachhu Shok Na Keejai|| Syaam Kahimuh(i) Jo Bateeyaa Tih Kibirthaa Sabh-hisoun(i) Leejai||
translation: Udhava said persistently, “O Lord of Braja ! do not be sorrowful; whatever Krishna has asked me to convey to you, all of you may listen to me;

gurmukhi: jwkI kQw suin hoq KuSI mn dyKq hI ijs ko muK jIjY ]vwih khXo nih icMq kro n kCU ieh qy qumro Pun CIjY ]899]
transliteration: Jaakikathaa Soun(i) Hot Khoushiman Dekhat Hijis Ko Moukh Jeejai|| Vaah(i) Kahyo Nah(i) Chint Daro Na Kachhodh Eh Te Toumro Phoun Chheejai||899||
translation: “He, hering whose words, the mind is pleased and seeing whose face all receive life-force, that Krishna has asked you to abandon all anxiety; you would lose nothing.”899.
